page.title: 05Farming
page.content: In this area farmers own animals and crops. In the fields they grow barley, wheat and rape. They have pasture land too,to keep the animals in the field boundaries of beech and hawthorn. Animals that we saw on the walk were chickens,horses and cows. At Beechwood Farm they had chickens,rabbits and horses,one of the horses was blind in one eye. Not very many farms have sheep,pigs,cows and goats,because the land is good for crops. Another farm we saw was Rummerhedge Farm,which is owned by some people in their mid 80's. The farm has only about six sheep,and two dogs. The farm is falling to ruin,with weeds and nettles all over the place. Another farm we saw was Wards Farm,which had forty cattle grazing in a field,and is near the back of the Oratory.
